Package com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.view

Class EditorView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.view.EditorView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dumpable, Disposable, VisibleAreaListener, TextDrawingCallback, java.awt.event.HierarchyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class EditorView
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextDrawingCallback, Disposable, Dumpable, java.awt.event.HierarchyListener, VisibleAreaListener
    A facade for components responsible for drawing editor contents, managing editor size and coordinate conversions (offset <-> logical position <-> visual position <-> x,y). Also contains a cache of several font-related quantities (line height, space width, etc).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.intellij.openapi.Disposable

      • getPreferredWidth

        public int getPreferredWidth(int beginLine,
                             int endLine)
        Returns preferred pixel width of the lines in range.

        This method is currently used only with "idea.true.smooth.scrolling" experimental option.

        Parameters:
        beginLine - begin visual line (inclusive)
        endLine - end visual line (exclusive), may be greater than the actual number of lines
        Returns:
        preferred pixel width

      • findNearestDirectionBoundary

        public int findNearestDirectionBoundary(int offset,
                                        boolean lookForward)
        Offset of nearest boundary (not equal to offset) on the same line is returned. -1 is returned if corresponding boundary is not found.

      • drawChars

        public void drawChars(java.awt.Graphics g,
                      char [] data,
                      int start,
                      int end,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      java.awt.Color color,
                      FontInfo fontInfo)
        Description copied from interface: TextDrawingCallback
        Asks to draw symbols from [start; end) range of given char array at given graphics buffer using given font info and color.
        Specified by:
        drawChars in interface TextDrawingCallback
        Parameters:
        g - graphics buffer to use
        data - target symbols holder
        start - start offset within the symbols holder to use (inclusive)
        end - end offset within the symbols holder to use (inclusive)
        x - 'x' coordinate to use as a start position at the given graphics buffer
        y - 'y' coordinate to use as a start position at the given graphics buffer
        color - color to use during drawing target text at the given graphics buffer
        fontInfo - font info to use during drawing target text at the given graphics buffer
